page.title: 16SEWAGE DUMP REFUSED
page.content: Calderdale Council proposed to build an additional refuse and sewage dump in {Outlane.} The local residents decided to fight them. The proposed dumping would mean 250 tonnes being dumped each week, needing 10 wagons a day to do this. The sludge would be dumped over fields and crops. Although 12% of lime would be added to combat the smell it was not thought to be completely effective. 250 people attended an action meeting in{Sowood}to plan how to fight these proposals, a further 2000 people signed an objection petition. The Halifax health inspector also spoke against the council's proposal because of the flies and vermin it would attract. Finally, on July 9th, planning permission for the proposed sewage scheme was unanimously refused. The residents had won!
